availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Baker (Boone County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Boone County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Stewart Baker and Elizabeth Baker. Married to Mary Elizabeth Miller Baker in Boone County, Kentucky on October 29, 1856. Father of James Milton Baker and William L. H. Baker. Farmer in Boone County in 1850. Farmer in Boone County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, District 2, p. 153A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Walton, p. 447.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boone County, Big Bone, p. 147B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Boone County Marriages, Film #000523724, p. 297 (on microfilm), (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "George Washington Black (25 Nov 1832-8 Nov 1906)," Memorial #15519962, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15519962 (accessed June 25, 2020).
